channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Christchurch mosque attacks: Terrorist sentenced to life in jail without parole
item.description: The man who carried out the mosque attacks in Christchurch on 15 March 2019 has been sentenced to a life in prison and will never leave jail.

item.title: Watch live: Muslim community leaders speak following terrorist's sentencing
item.description: Leaders of the Muslim community are speaking in Christchurch following the sentencing of the mosque attack terrorist.

item.title: Seven new cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand
item.description: There are seven new cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand today, six of them in the community, Director of Public Health Caroline McElnay says.

item.title: Live updates: Christchurch mosque shooter sentenced to life without parole
item.description: Follow all the reaction to today's sentencing of the man responsible for the March 15 Christchurch mosque shootings here.

item.title: Live: Covid-19 updates in New Zealand and the world on 27 August
item.description: A union representing medical laboratory workers says members taking part in partial strike action are being sent home without pay.

item.title: Students on standby to offer aroha to mosque victims
item.description: Canterbury's Student Volunteer Army has gathered outside the High Court in Christchurch to show solidarity and support for the victims of the 15 March mosque attacks.

item.title: Peaches from USA recalled after bacteria concerns
item.description: Peaches imported from the United States are being recalled due to potential contamination with Salmonella bacteria.

item.title: Mt Roskill Covid-19 'mini cluster' concerning to see ahead of level 2 move - Dr Siouxsie Wiles
item.description: A new 'mini cluster' of Covid-19 cases in Auckland identified yesterday is concerning to see on the cusp of the city lowering alert levels, microbiologist Siouxsie Wiles says.

item.title: Multiple failures by police in restraining man, who later died - IPCA
item.description: Police say the death of a man in custody in an incorrectly fitted spithood followed an extremely dangerous and violent arrest.

item.title: Convicted murderer and arsonist Tonia Bennett denied parole
item.description: Convicted murderer and arsonist Tonia Bennett, jailed for killing the mother of her ex-boyfriend in 2009, has been denied parole.

item.title: Family First New Zealand qualifies to register as charity, court rules
item.description: The Court of Appeal has set aside a Charities Registration Board decision to remove Family First New Zealand as a charity.

item.title: America's Cup: Phil Goff says some of Auckland's waterfront upgrade complete
item.description: Auckland's mayor says the completed infrastructure work on the waterfront to host America's Cup was under budget.

item.title: Christchurch mosque victims sent attacker 'strong message that he had failed'
item.description: A community adviser who has supported Christchurch mosque terror attack victims in court says people want a sentence of life without parole for the gunman.

item.title: Auckland councillor Efeso Collins calls for amnesty for people with expired visas
item.description: Pacific people with expired visas are reluctant to come forward for Covid-19 tests, because they are scared of the consequences, says Auckland councillor Efeso Collins.

item.title: Southern Community Laboratories workers on partial strike over pay
item.description: A union representing medical laboratory workers says urgent Covid-19 testing is not impacted by a partial strike at this stage, but if a settlement is not reached by next week, it will be.

item.title: Taranaki education leaders furious at govt funding for private school
item.description: Taranaki teachers are fuming at a government decision to fund an $11.7 million expansion project at the privately-run Green School in Ōākura.

item.title: Christchurch mosque attacks: 'We defy your actions of hatred' - Victims tell their stories as killer faces sentence
item.description: The loss of the 51 people who were killed in 15 minutes at two Christchurch mosques resonated around the world as they left behind 34 spouses, 92 children and more than 100 siblings. These are their stories.

item.title: Covid-19: Speeding fines, police pursuits increase during lockdown
item.description: Police officers issued more speeding fines during the nationwide lockdown than they did during the same period a year before.
